skill.name: current-location-weather
skill.description: Get current weather conditions for a location. Use this skill when users ask about weather, temperature, current conditions, forecasts, or any weather-related queries like "What's the weather?", "Is it raining?", "How hot is it outside?", "What's the temperature?", or "Should I bring an umbrella?". Supports automatic location detection via IP or specific location queries.
skill.summary: Get current weather conditions for a location. Use this skill when users ask about weather, temperat...
skill.author: DanielMax937

security_audit.summary: A straightforward weather fetching script using Python standard library. Makes documented HTTP requests to public weather APIs (ip-api.com and wttr.in) to retrieve weather data. No file access, no environment variables, no external commands.

content.value_statement: Users need quick access to weather information for planning their day. This skill fetches real-time weather data using IP-based location detection or user-specified cities.
actual_capabilities: Get current weather using IP-based location detection
Fetch weather for any specified city or location
Output weather data in human-readable text format
Provide structured JSON output for programmatic use
Display temperature, humidity, wind, and conditions
limitations: Requires network access to fetch data from external APIs
IP-based location provides city-level accuracy only
Uses free APIs without API key authentication
No extended forecast beyond current conditions

use_cases.title: Check daily weather
use_cases.description: Quickly check current conditions before leaving home or commuting

use_cases.title: Check destination weather
use_cases.description: Look up weather conditions for cities when planning trips

use_cases.title: Plan outdoor tasks
use_cases.description: Determine if conditions are suitable for outdoor meetings or activities

prompt_templates.title: Basic weather check
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the weather like right now?

prompt_templates.title: Specific location
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the weather in Tokyo, Japan?

prompt_templates.title: Trip planning
prompt_templates.prompt: Should I bring an umbrella when I visit London this weekend?

prompt_templates.title: JSON for automation
prompt_templates.prompt: Get the weather in JSON format for New York City

output_examples.input: What is the weather like in San Francisco?

best_practices: Specify city and country for best accuracy when IP detection may be imprecise
Use JSON format when integrating weather data into automated workflows
Handle network errors gracefully by providing fallback responses
anti_patterns: Do not assume precise location - IP detection is city-level at best
Do not make multiple rapid requests - APIs may rate limit
Do not rely on weather data for safety-critical decisions

faq.question: Does this skill work offline?
faq.answer: No. Network access is required to fetch weather data from external APIs.

faq.question: How accurate is the location detection?
faq.answer: IP-based detection provides city-level accuracy. Specify location for better precision.

faq.question: Can I use this with other Claude tools?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill outputs text and JSON formats compatible with most AI assistants.

faq.question: What data is sent to external services?
faq.answer: Only location information is sent to ip-api.com and wttr.in weather services.

faq.question: Why is the weather data sometimes missing?
faq.answer: Check network connectivity. Free APIs may have rate limits or service interruptions.

faq.question: How is this different from weather websites?
faq.answer: This skill provides a simple command-line interface without ads or tracking.
